    • Method Detail

      • setPhaseInverted

        public void setPhaseInverted​(boolean inverted)
        Description copied from interface: CommonEncoder
        Set the phase of the encoder so that it is set to be in phase with the motor itself. This only works for quadrature encoders and analog sensors.
        Specified by:
        setPhaseInverted in interface CommonEncoder
        Parameters:
        inverted - The phase of the sensor

      • getInverted

        public boolean getInverted()
        Description copied from interface: CommonEncoder
        Get the phase of the sensor. This will just return false if the user tries to get the inversion of the hall effect.
        Specified by:
        getInverted in interface CommonEncoder
        Returns:
        The phase of the sensor

      • getPosition

        public double getPosition()
        Description copied from interface: CommonEncoder
        Get the position of the motor. This returns the native units of rotations.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface CommonEncoder
        Returns:
        Number of rotations of the motor

      • getVelocity

        public double getVelocity()
        Description copied from interface: CommonEncoder
        Get the velocity of the motor. This returns the native units of RPM.
        Specified by:
        getVelocity in interface CommonEncoder
        Returns:
        Number the RPM of the motor

      • initSimulationDevice

        public void initSimulationDevice​(SpeedController controller,
                                 double gearbox_ratio,
                                 double max_rpm,
                                 double ramp_time)
        Description copied from interface: EncoderSimulation
        Init simulation for this encoder
        Specified by:
        initSimulationDevice in interface EncoderSimulation
        Parameters:
        controller - The motor controller that controls the encoder
        gearbox_ratio - The gear ratio between the motor and encoder
        max_rpm - The max RPM of the motor
        ramp_time - The approx amount of time it takes for the motor to go from 0-100% under load

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from interface: PeriodicComponent
        Method to be called periodically. Usually in the main robot loop (once per 20ms)
        Specified by:
        update in interface PeriodicComponent
